intro: Allocarya fragilis, commonly known as the brittleleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, wiry stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow with a white or pale yellow center, forming a daisy-like appearance. Allocarya fragilis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
